content.title: ALI Thrombolysis
content.definition: Catheter-directed thrombolysis with tPA effective for Rutherford IIa. Contraindicated in IIb/III or recent surgery/CVA.
content.statement: ALI Thrombolysis is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Acute-Limb-Ischemia that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding ALI Thrombolysis helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of ALI Thrombolysis include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of ALI Thrombolysis.

citations.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
